availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. King (Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, tinner and soldier)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Pamelia Nichols King in Muhlenberg County on December 3, 1863. Father of Margaret E. King. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant, first sergeant, and first lieutenant from October 3, 1861, to January 31, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McClean County, Calhoun Precinct, p. 207.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 303.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Muhlenberg County, KY, July 1863, p. 24, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 962.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County Marriages, p. 457. Find A Grave, "William T. King (1841-1904)," Memorial #74908424, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74908424/william-t.-king (accessed May 14, 2018).
